overview: This subject is the final extension of students as performers, theatre-makers and independent artists as they create a new work for public performance.
Students will be mentored through the creation and performance of new ensemble work and refine their performance skills, working independently and self-reflexively in collaborative settings.
ilo: apply advanced performance skills required to devise a public project;
research, conceive, develop, rehearse and present a new work for public performance;
apply advanced dramaturgical processes and knowledge to self-authored and collaboratively devised works;
apply and sustain a professional working ethos in independent and collaborative tasks and in communication with staff, industry and peers.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Studio process: contribution to devising and rehearsals of public performance outcomes

assessment.hurdle: Students must attend 75% of all scheduled classes and submit all assessment items to be eligible for a pass in this subject.

date_times.contact_hours: 260 hours, comprising rehearsal and dramaturgy classes as directed
